alert.note: Alert for Craig; Mayes (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 21 at 7:32AM CDT until May 21 at 9:30AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL CRAIG AND NORTHWESTERN MAYES COUNTIES... At 732 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. The heaviest rains have ended however flash flooding remains a concern as water run off continues. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Vinita... Pryor... Pryor Creek... Adair... Big Cabin... Pensacola... FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
